classes.cCustomNote: Any free elective can go here. Some GE requirements may be met by course selections within the emphasis; in that case, additional free electives may be required to reach a total of 180 units. If upper-division GE courses are used to satisfy emphasis area requirements, additional upper-division coursework may be required to satisfy the University's 60-units upper-division requirement.

One course from each of the following GE areas must be completed: A1, A2, A3, B1, B2, B4, Upper-Division B, C1, C2, Lower-Division C Elective, D1, D2, Upper-Division D, E, and GE Elective. Upper-Division B and Upper-Division D should be taken only after junior standing is reached (90 units). Refer to online catalog for GE course selections and Graduation Writing Requirement (GWR).

Upper-Division B and Upper-Division D should be taken only after junior standing is reached (90 units). Refer to online catalog for GE course selections and Graduation Writing Requirement (GWR).

Select one emphasis area in the catalog and choose courses in consultation with advisor. Courses should be from at least two different disciplines, and no more than half of them can have the same prefix. Courses cannot be used to meet other major requirements. See catalog for additional details.
